intro: Muehlbergella, commonly known as the white broom, is a genus of flowering plants in the legume family, Fabaceae. It consists of several species, most notably Muehlbergella glabra, which is native to southern Africa. These plants are shrubs or small trees characterized by their slender, often spiny stems and compound leaves. The flowers are typically small and yellow, arranged in dense, branched clusters. Muehlbergella species are adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing their resilience to drought and poor soil conditions.
